title: Authors and Citation
text: Shen X (2021). tidymass: R packages mass spectrometry data processing analysis. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tidymass: R packages for mass spectrometry data processing and analysis},   author = {Xiaotao Shen},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: tidymass
text: tidymass collection R packages designed MS-based untargeted metabolomics data processing. packages share underlying design philosophy, grammar, data structures. Tidymass comprehensive computational framework MS-based untargeted metabolomics data processing analysis, including raw data processing (peak detecting), data cleaning (missing value processing, data normalization, integration), statistical analysis, metabolite annotation, biological function mining (pathway enrichment, feature-based metabolic module analysis).  can install tidymass GitHub. can use tidymass_install() install packages tidymass. Now, tidymass contains 8 packages, listed :   massdataset used organize metabolomics experiment data mass_dataset class object, can processed tidymass packages.    massprocesser R package used mass spectrometry based untargeted metabolomics raw data processing.    masscleaner R package used metabolomics data cleaning.    massqc used data quality assessment control.    metid used metabolite database construction metabolite annotation.    massstat used statistical analysis.    metpath used pathway enrichment analysis.    tinytools collection useful tiny tools mass spectrometry data processing analysis.  questions tidymass, please don’t hesitate email (shenxt@stanford.edu) reach via social medias . shenxt1990 shenxt@stanford.edu Twitter M339, Alway Buidling, Cooper Lane, Palo Alto, CA 94304 use tidymass publications, please cite publication: X. Shen, R. Wang, X. Xiong, Y. Yin, Y. Cai, Z. Ma, N. Liu, Z.-J. Zhu* (Corresponding Author), Metabolic Reaction Network-based Recursive Metabolite Annotation Untargeted Metabolomics, Nature Communications, 2019, 10: 1516.Web Link. Thank much!
code: if(!require(devtools)){ install.packages("devtools") } devtools::install_github("tidymass/tidymass") library(tidymass) tidymass::tidymass_install(from = "github", force = FALSE)

text: four conflicts deliberately ignored: intersect, union, setequal, setdiff dplyr. functions make base equivalents generic, negatively affect existing code.

title: Conflicts between the tidymass and other packages — tidymass_conflicts
tidymass_install — tidymass_install
code: tidymass_install(   from = c("github", "gitee"),   force = FALSE,   upgrade = "never",   dependencies = NA,   demo_data = TRUE,   which_package = c("all", "massdataset", "massprocesser", "masscleaner", "massqc",     "metid", "massstat", "metpath", "tinytools"),   ... )

title: tidymass_install — tidymass_install
text: github gitee, China, try set "gitee". force Force installation, even remote state changed since previous install. upgrade One "default", "ask", "always", "never". "default" respects value R_REMOTES_UPGRADE environment variable set, falls back "ask" unset. "ask" prompts user date packages upgrade. non-interactive sessions "ask" equivalent "always". TRUE FALSE also accepted correspond "always" "never" respectively. dependencies dependencies want check? Can character vector (selecting "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo", "Suggests", "Enhances"), logical vector.TRUE shorthand "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo" "Suggests". NA shorthand "Depends", "Imports" "LinkingTo" default. FALSE shorthand dependencies (.e. just check package, dependencies). value "soft" means TRUE, "hard" means NA. demo_data Install demo_data package . which_package packages want install? Default . can set character vector. ... parameters devtools::install_github() devtools::install_git()
